meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting a line on a map connecting points of equal brightness.
meanings.sent1: The isophotal line on the map helped us identify areas with the same brightness level.
meanings.sent2: The photographer used isophotal measurements to ensure consistent lighting in the picture.
meanings.sent3: I tried to draw an isophotal line on my painting, but it ended up looking like a zigzag!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as isophotal as the sun, radiating warmth and brightness.
meanings.sent5: The isophotal concept made it easier for us to understand the distribution of light in the room.
